intro: Bentinckiopsis ponapensis, commonly known as the Ponapé bentinckia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating. Bentinckiopsis ponapensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
